text: Oracle against Jerusalem
\add The\add* oracle of \add the\add* valley of vision:
⸤What business do you have going⸥\f + \fr 22:1 \ft Literally “What to you then that you have gone” \f* up, all of you, to the roofs,
⸤noisy⸥,\f + \fr 22:2 \ft Literally “full of noises” \f* tumultuous city,
exultant town?
Your slain \add are\add* not slain by \add the\add* sword,
nor \add are they\add* dead from battle.
All of your rulers have fled together without a bow;
all of ⸤you who were found⸥\f + \fr 22:3 \ft Literally “your found ones” \f* were captured.
They were captured together;
they had fled far away.
Therefore I said,
“Look away from me,
let me ⸤weep bitterly⸥;\f + \fr 22:4 \ft Literally “be bitter in weeping” \f*
you must not insist on comforting me
for the destruction of the daughter of my people.”

For the Lord Yahweh of hosts has a day of tumult and trampling and confusion\f + \fr 22:5 \ft These three Hebrew words are alliterative: \fqa mehûmâû \ft \fqa meḇûsâû \ft \fqa meḇûḵâ \ft \f* in \add the\add* valley of vision,
\add a\add* tearing down of walls\f + \fr 22:5 \ft Hebrew “wall” \f* and a cry for help to the mountains.\f + \fr 22:5 \ft Hebrew “mountain” \f*
And Elam lifted up \add the\add* quiver,
with chariots\f + \fr 22:6 \ft Hebrew “chariot” \f* \add of\add* men\f + \fr 22:6 \ft Hebrew “man” \f* \add and\add* cavalry.
And Kir uncovered \add the\add* shield.
And this happened:
the choicest of your valleys were full of chariots,\f + \fr 22:7 \ft Hebrew “chariot” \f*
and the cavalry confidently stood at the gate.
And he uncovered the covering of Judah.
And you looked, on that day, to the weapons\f + \fr 22:8 \ft Hebrew “weapon” \f* of the House of the Forest,
and you saw that the breaches in the walls of the city of David were many,
and you gathered the waters of the lower pool.
And you counted the houses of Jerusalem,
and you broke down the houses to fortify the wall.
And you made a reservoir between the walls for the waters of the old pool,
but you did not look to its maker,
and you did not see ⸤the one who created it long ago⸥.\f + \fr 22:11 \ft Literally “its creator from far away” \f*
And the Lord, Yahweh of hosts, called on that day
for weeping and mourning,
and for baldness and girding ⸤with⸥\f + \fr 22:12 \ft Literally “of” \f* sackcloth.
But look! Joy and gladness,
the killing of oxen\f + \fr 22:13 \ft Hebrew “ox” \f* and the slaughtering of sheep,
the eating of meat and the drinking of wine!
“Let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die!”
And it was revealed in my ears \add by\add* Yahweh of hosts:
“Surely this sin will not be atoned for you until you die!”
says the Lord, Yahweh of hosts.
Oracle regarding Shebna
The Lord, Yahweh of hosts, says this:
“Go! Go to this steward, to Shebna,
who \add is\add* over the house:
‘What ⸤business do you have⸥\f + \fr 22:16 \ft Literally “to you” \f* here,
and who ⸤do you have⸥\f + \fr 22:16 \ft Literally “to you” \f* here,
that you have cut a grave cutting here for yourself,
carving his grave \add on\add* the height,
a dwelling place for him in the rock?
Look! Yahweh \add is\add* about to ⸤really hurl⸥\f + \fr 22:17 \ft Literally “hurl a hurling” \f* you, man!
And he \add is\add* about to grasp you firmly;
he will wind a winding tightly around you like \add a\add* ball, to a ⸤wide land⸥.\f + \fr 22:18 \ft Literally “land broad of sides” \f*
There you shall die,
and there the chariots of your splendor \add will be\add*,
disgrace to your master’s house!
And I will push you from your office,
and he will throw you down from your position.
And this shall happen:
On that day I will call to my servant, Eliakim son of Hilkiah,
and I will clothe him \add with\add* your tunic,
and I will bind your sash firmly about him,
and I will put your authority into his hand,
and he shall be like a father to the inhabitants\f + \fr 22:21 \ft Hebrew “inhabitant” \f* of Jerusalem
and to the house of Judah.
And I will put the key of the house of David on his shoulder,
and he shall open and no one \add will be able to\add* shut;
and he shall shut and no one \add will be able to\add* open.
And I will drive him in \add like\add* a peg into a secure place,
and he will become like a throne of glory to the house of his father.
And they will hang all of the heaviness of his father’s house on him,
the offspring and the offshoot,
all of the small vessels,
from the ⸤bowls to the jars⸥.\f + \fr 22:24 \ft Literally “vessels of the bowls to all of the vessels of the jars” \f*

On that day, ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 22:25 \ft Literally “declaration of” \f* Yahweh of hosts, the peg that was driven will move away into a secure place, and it will be cut down and fall, and the load that \add was\add* on her will be cut off. For Yahweh has spoken.’ ”
